result.execSummary:
The defendant Brent Ford Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: With Count 3, but consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 16 days time served, straight time.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges including:
DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, any bail on deposit to be applied. If Revoked, to be paid from 25% of prison funds and collected by DOC on extended supervision on case 14CF1636. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Court WAIVED all NON-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.

No contact with firearms.
Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

No violent contact with Helena R. and her minor children, and Helen R.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.

Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
Parenting classes.
Batterers Intervention program or a course in anger management- pending evaluation.

AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brent Ford Taylor

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brent Ford Taylor not in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per email from Probation Dept., defendant is currently in absconder status.  Court ordered defendant to serve 40 days of the condition time; straight time.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.

Defendant Brent Ford Taylor in court with attorney Mark S. Tishberg.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.
AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, concurrent to Count 3, but consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 16 DAYS time served, straight time.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for  24 MONTHS.

AS TO COUNT 3
The court sentenced the defendant to 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, concurrent to Count 2, but consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 16 DAYS time served, straight time.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for  24 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve (as to each count) 20 DAYS in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program, or a course in anger management -pending evaluation.
-Parenting classes.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No violent contact with Helena R. and her minor children, and Helen R.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, any bail on deposit to be applied, if revoked to be paid from 25% of prison funds, and collected by DOC on extended supervision on case 14CF1636 failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief. 
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for March 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.
Received & Filed, Justice Point VIOLATION Report: Positive Drug Test, Defendant has valid prescription.
Received & Filed, Justice Point VIOLATION Report: Positive Drug Test, defendant has valid prescription.
Received & Filed, Justice Point VIOLATION Report: Positive Drug Test -with valid prescription.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision for GPS & Electronic Monitoring.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers. No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms. Defendant has NO Release - 24 HOUR curfew.

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 4
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion of the state, Count 1 & 4 are Dismissed, But Read In for sentencing. 
AS TO COUNTS 2 AS AMENDED & COUNT 3
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing. Court Vacated Final Pretrial & Jury Trail date.

Defendant Brent Ford Taylor in court with attorney Mark S. Tishberg.  Defendant Brent Ford Taylor in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Plea & Sentencing.
AS TO COUNT 2
On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Disorderly Conduct, Domestic Abuse, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1), a Class B Misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 12, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Mark S. Tishberg in court, defendant Brent Ford Taylor not in court, in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Plea Hearing. Defendant not produced from bullpen. Defense counsel has not prepared for Plea Hearing, requested an adjourned plea hearing prior to trail date. Case adjourned for Plea Hearing in branch 23.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brent Ford Taylor in court with attorney Mark S. Tishberg.  Defendant Brent Ford Taylor in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Status Conference/Motion to Withdraw. Prior defense counsel previously withdrew before Judge Flanagan for branch 23. Attorney Tishberg recently appointed requested case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial, as well as potential Plea Hearing/Status Conference.  Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Court ordered State to provide copy of all discovery to defense counsel by 9/5/2014 by 4 pm to be available for pick up by defense counsel at D.A. office. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brent Ford Taylor in court with attorney Odalo J. Ohiku.  Defendant Brent Ford Taylor in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Br. 4 for Br. 23. 
Court accepted case from Branch 23 to take a plea on cases; (2014CF1126, 2014CF1636, 2014CF3069 and 2014CF3069).  Following a lengthy colleqy, the Court found that defendant did not indicate that he knowingly voluntarily pleaded and vacates all findings.   Attorney Odalo Ohiku informs court that there has been a breakdown in communication that is irreconcilable.  Motion of defense counsel to withdraw is heard and granted by the Court.  Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Case is adjourned for Status of Counsel in Branch 23 on 9-3-2014 at 8:30 am.   Case 2014CM196 returned to Branch 46 and remains calendared for Status Conference on 9-3-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld
Case spun to branch 04, Judge Flanagan.

Attorney Odalo J. Ohiku in court, defendant Brent Ford Taylor not in court, in custody.  Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Jury Trial. Defendant NOT produced, being transfered to hospital. Defense counsel requested case be adjourned for Jury Trial. Court advised defense counsel medical documentation will need to be submitted to the court. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Status Conference based on negotiations between state and defense counsel. Speedy Trial Demand time limits waived til next Jury Trial date due to adjournment. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for August 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Odalo J. Ohiku in court via telephone, defendant Brent Ford Taylor not in court, in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel unable to appear due to family emergency. Case remains set for trial, parties ready to proceed. Defense and court advised that the state may file new charges. Discussion as to global resolution of 14CF1126, 14CF1636 & 14CM196. Case adjourned for Jury Trial to branch 23.
All conditions remain.

Attorney Odalo J Ohiku in court, defendant Brent Ford Taylor not in court, in custody.  Cynthia M Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. ADA File NOT in court. Discussion regarding No contact order, and bail. Arguments from state and defense. The court raised bail to $1,000.00 CASH with all conditions remaining in effect. Victim not in court, state advised court of victim's request through victim witness advocate. Defense requested no violent contact order. State opposes. Court DENIED request, no contact order remains in effect. State advised court of possible new charges, state to file any amended information in advance of Final Pretrial date. State's offer remains open until 7/11/2014 at 5:00 p.m. Defense counsel requested Final Pretrial date to be rescheduled, GRANTED. Case adjourned for rescheduled Final Pretrial & Jury Trial in branch 23.

Attorney Odalo J Ohiku in court, defendant Brent Ford Taylor not in court, in custody.  Cynthia M Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced. Defense counsel recently appointed, requested a bail hearing to address no contact order. State to notify victim of next court date. Case adjourned for a bail/bond hearing in branch 23.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brent Ford Taylor in court with attorney Matthew A Lamke.  Defendant Brent Ford Taylor in custody.  Cynthia M Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Lamke informs court that there has been a breakdown in communication.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Case is adjourned for status of counsel to date, all prior dates remain set for trial.  Status conference scheduled for June 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defense counsel in court to request case be set for Motion To Withdraw as Counsel.  ADA Davis notifed via telephone. Case set for 5/28/2014 at 1:30 pm.

Attorney Matthew A Lamke in court, defendant Brent Ford Taylor not in court, in custody.  Michael C Schindhelm for Cynthia Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant NOT produced. Case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Court withheld ruling on Joinder, to be argued and decided at next court date.  All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Received & FIled, Justice Point Report.
State requesting modification of the No Contact orders. Defense objected. Court modified orders the a FULL no contact order.

Defendant Brent Ford Taylor in court with attorney Matthew A Lamke.   Defendant Brent Ford Taylor in custody.  Matthew J Torbenson for Cynthia Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Frank Yinko.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for May 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Brent Ford Taylor in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke previously in court.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Preliminary Hearing.  Attorney Lamke unable to appear, in branch 46. Court WAIVED Time limits due to counsel being unavailable. Case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in branch 23.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.
14RM018888  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff: 04-05-2014

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JDC (10/30/2005) OR ANY OF THE DEFENDANT'S OR HELENA R. CHILDREN, UNLESS AS APPROVED AND MONITORED BY THE BUREAU OF MILWAUKEE CHILD WELFARE OR CHILDREN'S COURT; NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH HELENA R. OR HELENA R.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Brent Ford Taylor in court with Student Intern TRISHA FRITZ under the supervision of attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Brent Ford Taylor in custody.  Catelin Autumn Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant AS TO MISDEMEANOR COUNTS 2, 3, AND 4.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge GRADY, Branch 23.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 23.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
